important_phrase: Elsewhere in the District, recent rains   generally improved soil moisture conditions and crop production
On balance, Sixth District business conditions appear to have improved   modestly in April and May

Although overall payroll employment   levels appear to have increased across much of the District, many businesses   still reported that they had a strong preference for increasing the hours for   existing staff and using temporary staff rather than hiring fulltime   employees
Bankers also cited increasing foreclosure   rates, bankruptcies, and loan delinquencies in several markets
Freight demand continued to improve from weak year-ago   levels
However, on a month-over-month basis, responses   from contacts showed that sales softened slightly
Vehicle sales increased from weak year-ago   levels, with foreign brands experiencing the strongest demand
Notwithstanding positive trends, the outlook remains cautious
Looking forward, First District staffing contacts largely express   increased optimism and predict gradual improvement through 2010
Increased   activity is leading firms that previously reduced headcount to hire selectively,   and merit increases have been reinstated
The median price of homes also showed modest   improvement in all markets
Headcounts are stable
Crop conditions in the District were slightly   better than normal for this time of year
Construction   activity improved slightly on the basis of increases in residential and public   building
Wge pressures increased only modestly from the previous   reporting period
Credit conditions improved, on   balance, in April and May
Inventory investment slowed
Construction activity   improved slightly from the previous reporting period
Consumer spending increased in April   and May
Employment was steady, and little hiring is expected   in the near future
Sales   figures from auto dealers showed a moderate improvement, whereas District   retailers saw their rate of sales growth slow
On the consumer   side, most bankers characterized loan demand as weak or flat
Current hiring is for replacement only
In general, new home sales improved slightly   during the past eight weeks and on a year-over-year basis
Overall, dealers are cautiously optimistic and   expect slow, steady sales growth through the summer months
Cattle and cotton prices have risen and remain strong, while grain prices have   weakened slightly
Activity   in manufacturing, staffing services, transportation services, housing and energy   grew modestly
Firms'   ability to pass on these cost increases remained limited
Overall loan demand softened during   the reporting period
Demand for transportation services was positive suggesting further   improvement in overall economic conditions
Builders increased starts due to   tight new home inventories and improved sales activity
Most contacts say Texas sales are faring slightly better than the   national average, and same-store sales are on track to hit low single-digit   nominal growth this year
Agricultural conditions improved since the   last survey period
Manufacturing activity expanded modestly, transportation activity   strengthened, and factory managers expected further production gains
District labor markets improved slightly and contacts generally reported little   wage pressure and few problems finding qualified workers
Deposits increased moderately after showing no change in the   previous three surveys
Some companies were having difficulty finding   qualified drivers, and a few contacts raised concerns about future capacity   constraints
Residential real estate   activity improved slightly in April and May, while the decline in commercial   real estate activity slowed
Restaurant sales declined with fewer diners and a flat   average check amount
Agricultural activity increased
Commercial real   estate was flat at low levels, and commercial construction activity was slow
Wge increases were subdued
) showed that manufacturing activity increased significantly in Minnesota   and South Dakota and increased slightly in North Dakota
Commercial real estate was slow
Consumer spending increased   moderately since the last report
Prices for hogs,   cattle, and cotton were higher, while prices for grains, soybeans, and milk were   roughly unchanged
" Consumer spending and tourism activity generally increased
Labor market conditions   improved slightly with permanent employment levels edging up in most Districts
Consumer lending weakened in most Districts
Business spending increased moderately   from the previous report
Public construction increased in Philadelphia,   Cleveland, and Chicago, but slowed in Minneapolis
Tourism activity   improved
Manufacturing-sector contacts continue to report   improvement in business activity and increasingly widespread plans to increase   capital spending

Contacts at small to medium-sized   banks in the District report mixed trends in loan demand: respondents indicated   decreased demand for consumer loans, increased demand for commercial mortgages,   and no change for residential mortgages and commercial and industrial loans
Contacts outside the   manufacturing sector continue to describe both business conditions and   employment levels as stable or rising modestly
Activity in Manhattan's co-op and condo market has leveled off, following a   modest pickup in the first quarter
Vehicle sales have reportedly slowed a bit in recent weeks
Retailers expect sales to expand modestly as long as   overall economic conditions and the employment situation improve
However, they noted increases in the cost of cotton goods and   international freight rates
Most of the surveyed banks indicated that credit quality measures have shown   little change since the last Beige Book, although some noted slight improvement
One manufacturer said,   "Conditions have improved slightly," and another said, "Activity is showing   signs of improving but at a slow pace
Contacts expect leasing activity to   increase slowly in the months ahead and rents to remain about steady
"It's definitely   a better year than last," one retailer remarked, "and we are selectively   expanding
Lastly, peach and apple conditions   in Wst Virginia ranged from fair to excellent, with most orchards in good   condition
Retail sales activity was virtually unchanged in recent weeks, but   auto sales improved
One respondent stated that   temp employment among District auto- and metals-related manufacturers improved   recently
Wile some bankers saw no   improvement in higher-priced home sales, several lenders reported significant   improvements in that segment from extremely low levels
Prices of raw materials increased at a   slightly quicker pace than a month ago, while finished goods prices grew at a   somewhat slower pace than earlier
Commercial real estate agents reported modest improvements since our last   report
Retail sales generally flattened in recent weeks,   but there were a few reports of improvement
Meanwhile, despite high levels of   inventory, extraction of natural gas increased modestly as demand showed signs   of firming
Banking contacts reported stable to   slightly increased lending activity
Compensation gains   remained constrained by high unemployment and limited hiring throughout the   District
Demand for   consumer loans remained weak on net
Capacity utilization remained at   very low levels for companies in the metal fabrication and wood product sectors,   but further modest improvement in demand was reported
Scattered reports pointed to some modest improvements in residential   construction, most notably in the repair and remodel sector
Retail sales remained somewhat   lackluster on net but continued to improve modestly
Emergence of these crops was ahead   of normal in most cases
Economic activity in the Eighth District has increased modestly since our   previous report
Credit standards for residential   mortgages were unchanged, while demand for these loans ranged from about the   same to moderately stronger
Additionally, a firm in the rail transportation industry announced   plans to make significant capital improvements to the rail network
Home sales declined 2 percent in Memphis over   the same period
Lower-priced items, apparel, and shoes were strong sellers, while higher-priced   items and gifts moved more slowly
